title: Warren Gatland reveals World Cup rallying cry from Wales captain Alun Wyn Jones
text:
Alun Wyn Jones sounded a rallying cry to his Wales team after they booked a tie with France in the World Cup quarter-finals - it's time to make yourself a hero.

Wales finished their Pool unbeaten with a sloppy bonus-point win over Uruguay - thanks to scores from Josh Adams, who took his fifth of the tournament, Nicky Smith, Tomos Williams, Gareth Davies and a penalty try.

And now Wales are eyeing unprecedented glory in Japan.

Alun Wyn Jones (left) has urged his Wales teammates not to leave the tournament with regrets

Warren Gatland praised his players for showing character in their Pool D victory over Uruguay

Wales confirmed top spot in their pool with a bonus-points 35-13 finale at Kumamoto Stadium

'Alun Wyn Jones probably said the best thing when he told the players: "We've got 240 minutes left to achieve something special,"' said boss Warren Gatland.

'There is a lot of confidence in the team. We have belief that if we play well enough against any side we can beat them.

'There is a massive amount of motivation for this quarter-final. These opportunities can change people's lives. I am pretty sure the guys don't want to go home next Monday.'

Wyn Jones was a replacement as Gatland made changes to his side for the final pool encounter
description: Alun Wyn Jones has inspired Wales at the Rugby World Cup by telling his teammates they have 240 minutes left to achieve something special, boss Warren Gatland has revealed.
